text.__SUMMARY__: Erica scoparia is a shrubby species of heath in the flowering plant family Ericaceae.  It occurs in the Iberian peninsula (Spain and Portugal),  Macaronesia, including the Canary Islands, Madeira and the Azores and in Mediterranean southern France, north Africa, Sardinia and Corsica.
text.Description:
Erica scoparia is a perennial evergreen shrub with small yellowish white to red-brown bell-shaped drooping flowers borne in  clusters at the ends of its shoots.
